mise_en_place.name: Mise en Place
mise_en_place.description: Professional kitchen preparation system - everything in its place before cooking begins
steps: Gather all ingredients and measure precisely
professional_tips: Use small bowls for pre-measured ingredients
Label containers with contents and time
Keep cutting boards separate for proteins and vegetables
mise_en_place.health_benefits: Reduces cooking stress, ensures food safety, promotes mindful cooking

deglazing.name: Deglazing
deglazing.description: Professional technique to create flavorful sauces from pan drippings
steps: Remove protein from pan, keep warm
Add liquid (wine, broth, or vinegar) to hot pan
Scrape up browned bits with wooden spoon
Strain if desired for smooth sauce
health_modifications: Use low-sodium broth instead of wine
Add fresh herbs for flavor without salt
Finish with lemon juice for brightness

professional_sauteing.name: Professional Sautéing
professional_sauteing.description: High-heat cooking method for quick, healthy preparation
professional_sauteing.technique: Keep food moving in hot pan with minimal oil
professional_sauteing.health_benefits: Preserves nutrients, requires minimal added fats
professional_tips: Season at the end to prevent burning

sugar_reduction_techniques.name: Sugar Reduction Strategies
sugar_reduction_techniques.description: Professional techniques for reducing sugar while maintaining palatability
steps: Gradually reduce sugar by 25% increments to retrain palate
Use natural fruit purees for sweetness and moisture
Incorporate spices (cinnamon, vanilla, nutmeg) to enhance perceived sweetness
Balance with healthy fats to slow sugar absorption
Use naturally sweet vegetables (carrots, beets, sweet potatoes)
professional_tips: Date paste provides fiber along with sweetness
Coconut milk adds natural sweetness and richness
sugar_reduction_techniques.chefrich_philosophy: Successful sugar reduction requires understanding flavor balance and gradual palate adaptation

natural_thickening_methods.name: Natural Thickening with Kuzu and Arrowroot
natural_thickening_methods.description: Traditional methods for creating smooth, healthy sauces without refined starches
kuzu_technique: Dissolve 1 tablespoon kuzu in 2 tablespoons cold liquid
Add to simmering liquid while stirring constantly
Simmer 2-3 minutes until clear and thickened
arrowroot_technique: Mix 1 tablespoon arrowroot with 2 tablespoons cold liquid
Add to hot liquid at end of cooking
Avoid boiling once added to prevent breakdown
natural_thickening_methods.professional_applications: Use for gravies, fruit sauces, and dessert preparations
natural_thickening_methods.chefrich_notes: Natural thickeners provide therapeutic benefits while creating superior textures

oil_selection_techniques.name: Choosing the Right Oil for Cooking
oil_selection_techniques.description: Professional guidelines for selecting appropriate oils based on cooking method and health goals
guidelines: Match oil smoke point to cooking temperature
Use unrefined oils for raw applications
Choose refined oils for high-heat cooking
Consider flavor profile and dish compatibility
oil_selection_techniques.chefrich_philosophy: Choosing the right oil preserves nutrients and prevents oxidation

fermentation_basics.name: Traditional Fermentation Methods
fermentation_basics.description: Ancient techniques for creating probiotic-rich foods
umeboshi_method: Use proper salt ratio (20% of fruit weight)
fermentation_basics.chefrich_notes: Traditional fermentation creates foods that are both preservation and medicine

ingredient_selection_techniques.name: Professional Ingredient Selection Methods
ingredient_selection_techniques.description: Systematic approach to choosing high-quality ingredients for health-focused cuisine
multi_sensory_evaluation: Assess color vibrancy and visual appeal
nutritional_assessment: Include variety of colors for antioxidant diversity
Combine cooked and raw foods for optimal nutrition
sourcing_hierarchy: Select whole foods over processed alternatives
Verify humane and sustainable production methods
ingredient_selection_techniques.chefrich_philosophy: Professional ingredient selection is the foundation of transformative, healing cuisine

bean_preparation_methods.name: Professional Bean Preparation Techniques
bean_preparation_methods.description: Comprehensive methods for cooking beans for optimal texture, flavor, and nutrition
soaking_guidelines: Soak beans overnight in 3 cups water per 1 cup beans
For black soybeans: 24-hour soak in salted water
Small beans like lentils don't require soaking

stovetop_method: Add salt at beginning of cooking for best flavor and texture
Bring to boil, skim foam, then simmer covered
Cooking time varies: 45 minutes for kidney beans, 30 minutes for lentils
pressure_cooking: Bring to full pressure over high heat
Reduce heat, maintain pressure for specified time
Allow natural pressure release for 10-15 minutes
Times: 30 minutes for black soybeans, 15 minutes for navy beans

flavor_enhancement: Add salt at beginning of cooking, not the end
Use aromatics like onions, garlic, ginger during cooking
Finish with fresh herbs, lemon juice, or vinegar
Toast spices like cumin for deeper flavor
Use cooking liquid in purees for better consistency
professional_tips: Dress beans while warm for better flavor absorption
Use reserved cooking liquid for consistency adjustments
Add delicate greens and final seasonings at the end
bean_preparation_methods.chefrich_philosophy: Properly prepared beans are complete proteins that support sustainable nutrition and digestive health
